definition: variant of 繚亂|缭乱[liao2 luan4]
to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The Snow Festival in Hokkaido is a dazzling spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 北海道的雪祭景观令人眼花撩乱。

sentences.english: Nancy's first book report is sure to be dazzling.
sentences.chinese: 南希的第一次读书报告确定会让人眼花撩乱。

sentences.english: Afternoon, woke up drunk, catkins fly sick.

definition: (literary) crisscross/uneven/disorderly/rim of the eye/variant of 欄杆|栏杆[lan2 gan1]
variant of 聯翩|联翩[lian2 pian1]
sinuous/meandering/to take a circuitous route/to toss about/vicissitudes/variant of 婉轉|婉转[wan3 zhuan3]
fine black hair/dried plum (sliced, as cake ingredient)
